hypotheses.title: Detection of Suspicious NPM Package Installation
hypotheses.action: Hunt for npm install commands executed with typosquatting package names in command line logs.

sigma.yaml:
title: Suspicious NPM Package Installation
logsource:
  product: windows
  service: sysmon
  category: process_creation
detection:
    selection:
      CommandLine|contains: 'npm install'
    filter:
      CommandLine|regex: '(.*npm install.*[a-zA-Z0-9]{1,4}\-[a-zA-Z0-9]{1,4}.*)'
    condition: selection and filter

splunk.spl: index=main sourcetype=process_creation CommandLine="npm install" | regex CommandLine=".*npm install.*[a-zA-Z0-9]{1,4}\-[a-zA-Z0-9]{1,4}.*"

methodologies_enriched.name: Windows Command Shell
methodologies_enriched.description: Adversaries may abuse the Windows command shell for execution. The Windows command shell ([cmd](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0106)) is the primary command prompt on Windows systems. The Windows

methodologies_enriched.name: Default Accounts
methodologies_enriched.description: Adversaries may obtain and abuse credentials of a default account as a means of gaining Initial Access, Persistence, Privilege Escalation, or Defense Evasion. Default accounts are those that are built

hypotheses.title: Unusual Network Traffic for NPM Package Downloads
hypotheses.action: Monitor outbound traffic for connections to uncommon or suspicious NPM registry domains.

sigma.yaml:
title: Unusual NPM Registries Network Traffic
logsource:
  category: network_traffic
  product: proxy
detection:
    selection:
      domain|endswith: '.npmjs.org'
    filter:
      domain|regex: '^(?!registry\.npmjs\.org).*$'
    condition: selection and filter

splunk.spl: index=main sourcetype=proxy_logs domain="*.npmjs.org" | where NOT like(domain, "registry.npmjs.org")
